item.description:
Since 1993, the Stroll has served as Nashua’s official kick-off to the holiday season.

Each year, close to 30,000 people from across New England visit downtown Nashua to enjoy this FREE holiday event.

The evening kicks off with a procession from City Hall to Railroad Square where the City’s official Christmas tree is lit.
Much of the downtown is closed to traffic for the evening, allowing Strollers to enjoy the live entertainment, sample offerings from street vendors, dine in downtown’s fine restaurants and do holiday shopping at our unique specialty shops and boutiques.

Schedule:

The Stroll has over 100 performances in a variety of indoor and outdoor downtown venues!

Beer Garden:

In 2008, an outdoor Beer Garden was added and it has grown to be a popular addition to the Stroll!

Your favorite draft beers, warm winter cocktails, live music, activities, give-aways, and more!

This is geared towards our 21+ “Strollers,” however under age children may enter with a parent & / or guardian.

Wristbands are issues at the door; Valid ID required.

Location: Corner of Main & High Streets Between Bank of America & Scontsas Jewelry

Hours: 5 – 10 p.m.

http://downtownnashua.org/calendar2-2/stroll/
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in front of the library.
item.name: 18th Annual Winter Holiday Stroll
